Henrikh Mkhitaryan and Eric Bailly are in line to return to the Manchester United side after they arrived with teammates at The Lowry Hotel on Christmas evening.

The two summer signings were spotted along with other members of the United squad and staff as they were greeted by fans at the city centre hotel, where United stay the evening before home matches.


Jose Mourinho confirmed Mkhitaryan and Bailly were available after recovering from recent injuries to face Sunderland in the Boxing Day fixture at Old Trafford and the pair could be restored to the first XI.

Morgan Schneiderlin, who requested to leave United in the January transfer window, will not be selected and has spent Christmas in France with his fiancee.

Memphis, who could follow Schneiderlin to Everton in the January transfer window, is also expected to be overlooked by Mourinho.

READ MORE
How United players celebrated Christmas
The United manager explained earlier this month he overlooked five players for the trip to Zorya Luhansk to 'protect' them. First-teamers Antonio Valencia, Matteo Darmian and Michael Carrick remained in England but so did Schneiderlin and Memphis, since Mourinho does not want to risk injury to the duo out of fear it could scupper their new year transfers.

When asked if Schneiderlin had requested to leave on Friday, Mourinho replied: "Yeah. Yeah. Great professional. Fantastic boy, very honest, very open and he opened his heart a couple of times.


Squad numbers


Jose Mourinho


Transfers latest
"And my answer is simple: if he's playing regular with me I have the right to say no way, if he's not playing regular I have no right to tell a player that if he wants to be happy you're going nowhere.

"So my answer was if the offer is right and our board thinks the offer is a good offer in relation to a very good player like Morgan I would not stop him to go."

Luke Shaw is the only United player unavailable for Sunderland's visit through injury, although Mourinho indicated he was almost over it.

"We don't have many injuries," Mourinho told MUTV. "Even the Luke Shaw injury is coming to an end. We are fine. People are happy." Shaw trained separately from his teammates in midweek.

Henrikh Mkhitaryan and Eric Bailly are in line to return to the Manchester United side after they arrived with teammates at The Lowry Hotel on Christmas evening.

The two summer signings were spotted along with other members of the United squad and staff as they were greeted by fans at the city centre hotel, where United stay the evening before home matches.


Jose Mourinho confirmed Mkhitaryan and Bailly were available after recovering from recent injuries to face Sunderland in the Boxing Day fixture at Old Trafford and the pair could be restored to the first XI.
